Title: Object: Sir Ralph Abercromby, K.B.
Description: Portrait of Sir Ralph Abercromby; full-length, turned to the left, gesturing with his right arm and his left at his hip, in the dress uniform of a lieutenant-general, a cocked bicorne hat over his queue wig, the sash of an officer about his waist and another over his left shoulder, the star of the Order of the Bath upon his breast, his infantry officer's sword by his side, a battle in Egypt raging behind him, with regiments of cavalry and infantry before the Pyramids, Abercromby and his staff mounted to the foreground Etching
Curator's comments: From an album of Kay's work in BM P&D, apparently assembled by himself, with manuscript notes: see 1935,0522.13.1.
Bibliographic references: O'Donoghue 1908-25 / Catalogue of Engraved British Portraits preserved in the Department of Prints and Drawings in the British Museum (undescribed)
